3k12ZGT4Ot4CshN5t-kHyg.text: While I certainly had high hopes for this establishment it had hits it had misses. Japanese fried  chicken with spicy mayo dipping sauce was a hit as was the takoyaki appetizers. Pork ramen  noodles were chewy with a great bite to them broth was neutral and clean taste pork was inedible dried out pathetic. Should have opted for spicy miso and anything other than this pork nonsense. Bathroom clean and parking was free but I'm still staying with Futo Buta in Charlotte until someone takes the crown.

lob7s5n-iuPDlXNSEFH52g.text: Best sushi in Charlotte. Knowledgeable staff, and prompt, professional service. The black garlic ramen is my favorite!

sf0XT1oMljQKj_bGp9mxpQ.text: I was insulted by the management. Never experienced anything like it. I tried to order a beer at a table with friends and asked why my drink never came out despite multiple attempts and they said I was cut off bc I appeared drunk. The reality was a came in after the group and had one beer one hour prior. In no way shape or form did I appear anything but normal. They canceled our entire tables order halfway through. Once they realized they had royally F'd up they begged us not to write reviews. Well I can't it was the single worst experience I've had at a restaurant.

xRblykFV3gAYuXOD24cynA.text: We went on a Saturday night and it was busy which is good and bad. Good because it's worth it but bad because we did wait over an hour. The seafood ramen is phenomenal and I would definitely come back. Service was good and the restaurant wasn't too loud

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood ramen :)

NY7FKDbDOOAqjIceyIiXdg.text: First and foremost, the atmosphere is trendy and hip! I particularly liked the lighting, the sexy bar, and the concrete flooring!   This is another sushi/ramen place; this genre of restaurants seems to be all the rage now! I am neither a sushi fan or a ramen fan, but still wanted to check out Yume. Plus, my friend, Kathleen, suggested that we meet there. I do whatever Kathleen tells me to do!   For me, the menu was a bit limiting.  We were there for lunch, and I was curious to know if they had a more varied dinner menu, but never found out. There was only one thing on the lunch menu that appealed to me and that was the vegan ramen bowl. The bowl came out very quickly after we placed our orders. The service was really good here!  Our bouncy server was efficient and friendly.   There were a lot of different kinds of mushrooms in my bowl. I like mushrooms, but the broth was just a bit too earthy for my taste. I ate every drop of it, so it wasn't objectionable. It just wasn't what I would be anxious to get again.  I would definitely consider taking a sushi loving friend to this restaurant, or someone who likes ramen noodles in a pork belly kind of broth.   One other thing:  as always, I ordered iced tea with my meal.  One sip of this tea had me about ready to gag. The server told me that they did not brew their own tea, but that it came from a syrup. Just yuck.  Yuck. Yuck.  This is the frickin' south and as such, all restaurants should be sensitive to the iced tea drinking NEEDS of their customers!  Come on YUME, brew your own tea, for heaven's sake!  I will come and show you just how easy it is.  Good tea would have made my earthy ramen broth go down just a lot easier!  / This is a trendy restaurant in a trendy part of town. Glad I went.

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

1xB-Kpb9n4VpVd1bCQxm-A.text: Had dinner here last night with my son. He had an urge for "RAMEN". At entry. around 6:30 PM, dining room was not crowded but hostess wanted to seat us in between two occupied tables. She seemed annoyed when I asked to be seated elsewhere, although she did let us sit at a different table. After this small seating episode, we were greeted by Susan, fabulous and personable table attendant. I am not a big "foodie" so I was delightfully surprised to see grilled avacado on the appetizer menu. My son, ordered Miso Soup as an appetizer - twice! Both were excellent in flavor and timing. The meals arrived soon after the appetizers. I had the Vegan Ramen and my son ordered the Curry Ramen. Each soup dish was abundantly flavorful, filling and simply good. Altogether an enjoyable experience and I will return.

M5oFWCPHP93rb1wJScnsXg.text: This restaurant surprised me with the quality of food it offered. They have a wide selection of items to choose form, friendly and quick service, all at a decent price.

V9XueIL3He2oVrWxYf7wFQ.text: We came in on a Monday after work because not very many place are open after 9:30-10pm for Asian food. Yelp says they are open until 11 so we figured this would be perfect. We have been wanting to come here anyway.  There was only 2 other couples there who left pretty much when we walked in.  We sat at the bar. Another gal came in and asked if kitchen was open. The bartender said they close kitchen around 10 but bar stays open.  I would personally close it too if no customers. Reason I put this in review is I would hate someone to go here and they decided to shut it down even tho yelp says open to 11.  Bartender was VERY friendly and a nice guy. Of course there was talk between staff about their day and cleaning up blah blah blah that didn't make for the best experience but we were in this business before in the past. I ordered Gyoza and my man got miso soup to start. Came out quick. Decent but not DAMN that was good. I got the coconut curry Ramen and he got the Japanese curry. He LOVED his and it was super spicy. Me.... it was good just not sure I was in the mood. I will def be back because I want the full experience. We didn't have any drinks, it was later and dead. It drives my boyfriend nuts when he can hear the servers talking personally (complaining). We love good food, we love spending money on food and experiences. I saw other reviews of the live crabs so again....we will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai coconut ramen
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Japanese curry

SAG7G4uwkP_I8acz9bIKpQ.text: Limited parking and menu during the day. No bartender during lunch on Saturday so don't ask for a specialty drink; only sake, beer and wine were available at that time. The bar was fully stocked and we could see someone cleaning the bar, but no staff member was a "bartender".   Seafood Ramen is only available during dinner hours. Sashimi is overpriced. (For example, $4 or $5 for ONE slice of salmon??) Ramen broth had very little flavor and the noodles were a little undercooked.   Whenever we visit ramen shops, we don't have to upgrade our ramen in order to get the tender pork, but here, you do. At every other ramen shop we've visited, tender pork belly was included. On our visit to Yume, the pork included was not tender at all and the (tender) pork belly was an add-on. The pork belly was also not sliced properly, chunky and reminiscent of carnitas :) The  marinated egg, a traditional standout ramen ingredient, was lackluster and inconsistent between two bowls. One egg was hard-boiled, ice cold and wrong. The other egg was nearly raw, very runny and, again, wrong and neither was marinated to the (yellow) center nor sliced in half as I'm accustomed to having. On the other hand, I guess you can't slice a runny egg. The water was quite tasty. Service was "okay".   I wanted to visit this place for the longest and was brought here to celebrate my birthday. Unfortunately, we were extremely disappointed and will not visit again.

HsJabVi2MYBcJ26gQDxqSQ.text: Pricey, but worth it. The quality of ingredients used are top notch. I had the Pork Tonkatsu Rice bowl. I wish the server told me the difference between that one and the other. The one I had included the sauce poured into my rice and I don't like soupy rice. However, it was delicious when I heat it up in the microwave the next day. The flavor of the juice was absorbed into the rice. My hubby loved the spicy miso ramen. He said it was better than the spicy miso ramen at Whole Foods in Waverly off of Providence/485. The glass sodas were a nice touch to the place. Will probably just come here for date night.   Eclectic crowd, great staff, would definitely promote to my friends about this place.

PTqhD1QXAt626MGUaf6Kxw.text: Similar to other reviewers about the ramens...I ate lots of ramens and I have to say their broth is on the bland side...  So if you decide to eat a bowl of ramen then you already committed to eat kinda unhealthy for the day.  I can taste their broth has the texture but the flavor need to be little more heavier...  The meat is not really tender and the egg is not quite there yet...the combination is not really bring out a tasty bowl of ramen...  If you gonna call your self an asian Restaurant then you have to be BOLD with yr dish...U have to be original...  I always go to Tiger Den when I used to live in Houston TX...their garlic black bean sauce is da bom and I haven't found anything close to it inda Queen City!!!  I'll probably give them one more try and update my review...as for now 3 stars is more for service and decoration...

unwrM7uOAWCflw2D7Jx74A.text: Maybe Charlottes best sushi? If not, then it is certainly first class sushi with a sophisticated preparation. Some rolls are "torched", which adds an amazing flavor dimension. Try at least one of those. They also have some top quality fish from Japan that is available on occasion.   The restaurant is open, bright and airy. There is a 10-12 seat bar plus an equally sized sushi-bar along with about 20 tables. There is a good selection of wine and beer and saki of course. Our bartender, Chris was very knowledgeable, friendly and steered us to some good plates.  Try the gyoza's, they are clearly home made and very tasty.

JlIw0XCNBKNasqlP2-kSPQ.text: Okay so the space is beautiful and the service was great as well! I'll start with I did like--the gyoza is amazing like so good that we ordered two helpings! But, I did not enjoy the ramen at all. I got the spicy miso and just felt the broth lacked flavor. It didn't taste like anything spectacular and I had to drown mine in soy sauce just to give it a little seasoning. This place has so much potential but if you're a ramen restaurant I expect the ramen to be decent not taste like seasoned water.

oWaUGa4EVdMr5cvIOgZanw.text: I really wanted to like this spot more. Similar to other reviews, I found the broth to be bland (I had the fermented garlic ramen).  Also, the pork was not tender at all and was difficult to eat with the ramen.  There are better ramen options in south end.

rsDeQEfGUmzJ0r38WYiIMQ.text: Location, staff, decor, and food were all wonderful. I had the miso soup and one of the cucumber sushi rolls. The ramen looked good as well. They also offer complimentary valet parking, so no parking stress.

iX4joiJ1P6vy_d7VLKxXBg.text: I was super excited to hear that a ramen shop was coming to the area. I actually went on the 'first day' but they weren't ready/open yet but I didn't get that memo. So I finally made it back. The wait wasn't long, I'd say about 10 minutes but that was okay since we were still waiting on the rest of our party to arrive. The gentlemen in the suite was really polite and friendly. He checked up on us a couple of times while we were waiting. The place is small but not too small. Can't go wrong with pork belly so I had to get the Kakuni Bao. The pork just melted in my mouth. I think it had a mayo base that didn't go right in my opinion. My son had the tempura shrimp and veggie. He's not a veggie person so he was a little disappointed that there was only 2 shrimps. I ate his veggies which was light and crispy. We also tried the takoyaki. The squid flakes on top gave it a move fishy taste. It moving from the heat always gets people. I would have liked more or a bigger piece of octopus in it. I love ramen so I had to get that. I got the spicy miso ramen. It had a great pork broth. The noodles were cooked perfectly. The egg was a little too done for me. I like the yolk to be really runny. The pork was thick but I like mines thinly sliced. My son ordered the salmon teriyaki which was put in the same time as all of our order but somehow forgotten so he didn't get his meal until we all were done eating. And to top it off, it was such a small piece of salmon so that left him still hungry. This place is pricy than other places but that's probably because it's towards uptown.

wnAwXZp453-c2dKuOFc1zA.text: Everything from the drinks, to appetizers and entrees were spectacular. We got tagoyaki, edamame, sushi and ramen (spicy miso). The uni nigiri was butter, so fresh. The ramen broth had incredible flavor and was not viscous (how I prefer), I don't like thick stew(y) ramen. The spacing of tables, our waitress and our wait time were all five stars. I highly recommend and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon skin, uni, and yume roll.

Ptp40hLDZvv7kMZysbxtng.text: Honestly I went to yume to try the pretty flower sushi(Sakura) , but I was impressed overall. We sat at the sushi bar and the service was great. We had steam buns, gyoza, and another dish which was not memorable. It was a great date spot and besides being Instagram perfect the sushi was delicious. It was also reasonably priced, compared to like O-Ku

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flower sushi!

S2X2u1lXfgr02Kg-WHxmUg.text: I was there 2 weeks ago,  and the food went downhill fast. The Sushi was all of a sudden much smaller and not authentic anymore. It felt like they lost their Sushi chef. Their fried chicken (tori karaage) was spoiled. I hope this experience was an outlier.

n0PLC7gatdDD_E9uJ4VkKA.text: New sushi and ramen spot, two of my favorite things. Giving four stars because the service was a little underwhelming, the food runners dropped off our food and before we tried it the server asked how it was and never came back.  I was hoping to get some extra ginger / soy, but by time she came back we were pretty much done, so just grabbed checks.   From the menu, we tried the tuna avocado app (really nice!), the tori ramen (just okay) and the spicy miso tonkotsu ramen (yum).  I'll give them another shot once the newness dies off and hopefully service improves.

Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

hDCsXcICMnjWFen8FV9Omw.text: Honestly want to give my experience 1 star. Having had ramen in places like NY and CA, this was so bland. For $23 (including taxes) I could have done myself a favor and went to Asian grocery store and got a months worth of amazing ramen. I ordered seafood ramen. Came with 3 very tiny tempura shrimp, 3 mussels that claimed they were mussels. Zero meat in them whatsoever. Harris Teeter sells mussels for less then $10 for a bag and they are meaty. And 3 less then dime size clams. I'll pass from here on out. I wish I had taken a pic. I don't eat pork so seems like most great reviews are about the pork dishes.

1zLOT-V8_o6X6IKyFmaCTw.text: Our favorite place for sushi and ramen.   The spicy miso ramen is delicious and better than any other ramen in the city. To those who prefer that other ramen place (FB), bye *wave*. So sad to see you go. Not really. Lots of ramen choices for everyone, including vegan. The seafood is another hit with us.  They have a plethora of appetizers that they do a spectacular job with it. Our faves: takoyaki, hamachi n chips, mackerel, poke, gyoza, pork belly buns and more. Did I mention hamachi n chips? These are BOMB. If you like ceviche, you may enjoy these.   Their sushi is amazing, they have an option for you to aburi your nigiri (flame torched) and this really adds another dimension of flavor to your sushi. You have to try it if you are a nigiri lover. We recommend trying the tuna and salmon aburi, especially the belly cuts. YUM. :P   The place is nice and spacious and looks beautiful. As a bonus, you get great views of hipsters riding by on their scooters.

Btxu5yryMbgDxjp3F1Q2Eg.text: Went for Charlotte Restaurant Week and the food was amazing especially for the value.  Got the hot sake as the drink, the carafe is really big. It was okay, but not super enjoyable because it definitely had very low alcohol content, I suggest getting the beer or a soft drink that you would enjoy more.   For appetizer got the tempura veggies, comes with about 6 pieces, simple crispy. Friend got the fried oyster, said it didn't taste like too much but the texture was amazing.  Main course, recommend getting the ramen, much better than the pork donburi I got.  Dessert was good. Simple mochi ice cream piece.

cn8ZNiiAROmosHMe8uaGwg.text: Sadly, Yume is not very yum-my. I'm sure I'm not the first person to make this joke, but I was pretty underwhelmed by my lunch here.   Since we couldn't get the website to work at all (menu just doesn't load on phone, iPad, desktop, or any other technology), we basically had to rely on Yelp photos and then just go there. The restaurant is cute enough, but we were given two very different menus and were unsure how to proceed. My wife's menu had three additional pages that mine didn't. I'm assuming I accidentally got a dinner menu, but I'm not sure.   We started with the Sakura sushi, which I thought was going to be this beautiful flower thing I had seen online somewhere. It was instead very average and tasted maybe one step above grocery store sushi. My cocktail (some rum concoction) was okay. Glass was given to me half full, or maybe I'll say half empty if I'm feeling pessimistic. Then the ramen came. I had the tonkotsu spicy miso. It wasn't spicy at all. Broth definitely lacked flavor. I had to add chili flakes. The pork was greasy and underwhelming. The noodles were a lot thicker than I've had in most ramen. I finished it, but I wasn't thrilled by any means.   Our waitress was nice when she was around, but she abandoned us for large stretches of our meal.   There was a little kid next to me who also ordered ramen. She leaned over to her dad and said, "I like Futo Buta better." Me too, young foodie. Me too.

XZ5Sw4OFgqLm4Icy1CFg0w.text: Visited Yume about two weeks after their opening date and I must say, I was very impressed with their service as the restaurant and bar were completely full with people waiting for tables. Yume's previous location had about 6-7 tables, so to transition so smoothly to the large location they are at now was awesome to see! We ordered the custom sashimi platter (let the chef know how much you want to spend and then they'll give you what fits in that price range), all of the ramen, and multiple appetizers. Everything was super fresh, including the freshly fried tempura, and delicious!

KWUO_yLmYMBrMHZklZYlYw.text: We've been wanting to try this place as it looked like a neat restaurant while driving by one night. Took the family last night -  (5) of us - service was EXTREMELY slow, it was 5:45p and tables were not set.  We had to wait to be seated and had to wait for our food a VERY long time. Staff was not friendly and server never brought the two appetizers ordered. Hostess area was a mess. TVs in restaurant playing soccer game - a turn off.  On a good tip: sushi rolls were huge and curry pork dish was pretty tasty. Everyone felt the dinner was slow and just blah!  Too many better places to eat in CLT.  Yume gave us no reason to come back.

S4-YNhi7GAK8XK9ttmrdhA.text: Everything was awesome and, considering location + food quality, VERY reasonably-priced.  I rarely find a place serving takoyaki and other traditional Japanese items.  Furthermore, they have a natto sushi roll.  My grandmother loved natto so I really wanted to try it.  The chef accommodated my request and gave me a side of it.  The staff were pleasant and attentive, the atmosphere was comfortably casual yet upscale, and we didn't get a pretentious vibe at all.  If you like tuna, try the ume roll.  So good!

Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. fermented black garlic ramen, natto, and kimchi

_IAUQMzYWKx7FXUkzy1xtg.text: Me and wife were heading out to eat to another restaurant but upon arrival to our supprise it was over an hour wait. We pulled off wondering where to go eat and she found a place named Yumi. I said sure why not and drove a couple blocks away to a really nice place. Nestled away on Mint, this place was looked great! We were immediately seated and our server Chris was very nice and polite. We had the octopus hush puppies which was new to me but very delicious. I ordered the seafood ramen which was oh so good. It was definitely fulfilling and honesty I couldn't even finish all of it. My wife enjoyed the black garlic ramen and she finished the entire thing (I don't know where she puts it). The ambience was cool and refreshing and the food was great. I'll definitely be coming back and I'll recommend this to everyone.

Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Octopus hush puppies.

BsJGRFTbzOmrOdqZXtj9hw.text: I CANNOT stress how amazing this place is. Great atmosphere, great service. Authentic Japanese. They also have a bar. Ramen, pork belly buns and gyoza were great. Fish flies in fresh every week from japan and you can TASTE the difference. We ordered nigiri and there was no fish smell whatsoever. Fish was like a soft buttery cloud with a refreshing finish. Wow. Also enjoyed the fatty tuna maki roll, didn't realize there was a little wasabi in them which wasn't mentioned on the menu. Tuna tower had some heat to it also but was very good. Box sushi with tuna and eel was also great. Told my waitress we had a birthday and ordered the green tea cheesecake and she put a candle in it to celebrate. Also recommend spicy miso ramen!Plan to come back and try the wagyu!

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

2C84-WFcMeiDs0VeysHrWg.text: So I've dreaded writing this review and it really hurts me to write this but I was expecting so much from this experience. Now I know it was the opening week and I always go in to opening weeks knowing there will be hiccups and that they are perfecting their craft with a live audience but there were a lot of flaws in our visit and a major one was the food.  I've been very excited for the opening of Yume. Following them on social media really hyped me up. I absolutely love San Francisco ramen and to hear that the owners/chefs ran a restaurant in that area and were bringing their talent to the Queen City warmed my heart.   I was sad that they had to push back their opening one day but I knew I would make it in during opening week.   Upon arriving the lobby was packed and the restaurant seemed packed. It was peak dinner time so that was to be expected. My family decided to go and try and with people five people I expected a wait. We were quoted 30/35 minutes and that was kool especially for what we thought was going to be delish ramen. The kids needed to go to the restroom and upon traveling to it I noticed a lot of empty tables. Now I didn't think anything of it because they may not have had the waitstaff to accommodate seating all those tables so I turned a blind eye. When we returned to the lobby there was a small tiff between the wait staff and the hostess about being able to seat the tables. Again opening week turn a blind eye. They are figuring things out.   Once we were seated we were welcomed by our amazing server Li. She was phenomenal. She took great care of us and was very open to our feedback unlike some others (to be discussed later). My sister and I ordered the Fermented Black Garlic Tonkotsu and my nephew and mother ordered the Salt Tonkotsu. We also placed an order togo for my father of the Salt Tonkotsu minus the corn.   The live crabs at the sushi bar kept the kids  very occupied while we waited about 15 minutes for our Ramen to arrive. The Ramen seemed to arrive quicker to the tables than the sushi. Even when we inquired about how long it would take for our food Li informed us that we should be fine because we didn't order any sushi.   Now to the taste.... oh wait there wasn't any. So the broth had absolutely no flavor to it. It had color and looked like any other Tonkotsu Ramen I've had in the past but one big thing was missing was flavor. It tasted like enhanced water, kinda like the La Croix of Ramen broth. We let Li know and she notified the kitchen but to no avail we were told that it basically was just us and our tastebuds. She related that the Fermented Black Garlic was just an enhancement to the Ramen but it didn't enhance. We also told her that our Pork Chashu was very fatty. So fatty to the point that we were taking the small amount of tender lean meat we could find from the fat and putting it to the side. She told us that she was informed that that's the way it's suppose to be. Now I've have a fair amount of ramen in my life and the Pork Chashu has never been that poor of a cut with that much fat nor the broth that flavorless!   So with very crushed dreams we paid our bill and left. I'm not really sure if I'm willing to come back. I read that they will have 14 Ramen options in the future and that does peak my interest but if the broth is the same broth from this visit I'll pass. Plus they didn't even have narutomaki which is my 4 year old niece's favorite.   I gave Yume 2 stars: one for the service and one for the decor. If it was left to the ramen they would get no stars.   Yume 1508 S Mint St Charlotte, NC 28203 Wednesday August 15, 2018 7:45pm

Xt2RKmP_AI-dHdTRPwn9Sw.text: Amazing sushi and service! Ashley took care of us and was courteous enough to let us know the drink specials that day. She waited on us hands and foot through our entire meal. I ordered the Hoshi sushi specialty roll which was absolutely delicious- fresh tasting with a slight crunch to tie the roll together. My friend dining with me enjoyed the Hi sushi roll which she finished before I was halfway finished with mine. A perfect taste and amount of sushi coupled with a wonderful dining experience makes me want to go back again tonight. Thank you!

AC92EK7NKwLJjwwwMRz7xA.text: No wonder why the ratings are so horrible, if only I did my research. I went to YUME (aka wannabe futo buta, byeee Felicia) back in March of 2019. Totally forgot to write my review until today! My friend sent me the picture of the raw chicken that was served in her ramen back in March. I thought that I should let all the lovely yelp reviewers see. So basically in March of 2019; we went to dinner and never went back. My friend was served RAW CHICKEN in her ramen (you must see the picture or it just didn't happen jk). I told our server Chris, but he assured us that the chicken was not raw but broiled "FOR HOURS". Good thing I become a vegetarian four years ago (save the animals plzzz). After Chris obviously doesn't know what a cooked chicken looks like, we got hold of the manager. She brought out a new chicken but it looked like trash. My friends meal was not discounted or compensated. End story: Yume is trash, just wait in futo buta's line (WORTH IT). I hope Yume closes and a real restaurant will go in its place.

IJTFBLWXkS0h5yMT5QpOBg.text: Completely unacceptable!! We spent a normal day out at breweries and tried to end our Sunday here and we were denied alcoholic beverages, even those who had not been drinking during the day.  Given the area, they are beyond strict regarding serving alcohol. Most of us were just trying to eat at the end of the evening and they treated us horribly!

2fymFSQ15-ocY64kM7Vmuw.text: My fiance and I have began a little list of trying as many ramen places as possible, and this place marked ramen restaurant #5! I found it after a quick Google search, and the other reviews compelled us to give it a go. And boy, am I glad we did! It was a bit difficult to find parking, but we're not from Charlotte and we're probably just Big DumbsTM.  But still, after finding parking and walking up to the building, we were pleasantly surprised to see a rainbow flag sticker on the window. As members of the LGBTQ+ community, we found it nice that they had it on their window.   Anyway, on to the actual visit.  We were seated promptly, and the dining area had a very calm, warm atmosphere. Their menu was easy to understand, and our server was eager to answer any questions we may have had.  My fiance got the tonkatsu ramen, and I the fermented black garlic ramen. We shared a specialty roll as well (can't recall which one- oops) The ramen was amazing! Honestly, the best both I've had. The flavors were all present and mended perfectly. The meat was tender and had very little fat, and the soy sauce egg was cooked to perfection! The bowl size wasn't overwhelmingly large, but had more than enough to have you walking away full. The sushi roll was beautiful and tasted wonderful.  All in all, we will definitely be back. It's a bit pricey compared to a ramen shop we frequent in Greenville, but it won't break the bank. The service was a 10, the food was a 10, everything about it was a solid 10!

0hIMTI7iUQZmWvduXiWjcg.text: We have had a lot of authentic ramen while traveling and decided to try this one in Charlotte since we live near by. I thought it was good for being a ramen restaurant in Charlotte. The egg was good and I would probably go again but order a different ramen. I had the curry ramen which was alright. I got tired of the broth after a few bites. It might have been too strong of a broth for me, that's all. The sushi was really good!

lrWaQxRoBgL-dyAUST_SGw.text: First time visiting here.. I have to say it will definitely not be the last.  Our server Chris did a fantastic job with knowledge of menu when it came to allergens. Pace of service was amazing! Sushi chefs were friendly and knowledgeable as well.  These guys are more than willing to do what's needed to meet allergen needs such as GF and dairy free.  Our appetizers were  Edamame tossed with miso  And  Tuna tower made GF   Entree  Fermented black garlic Ramen.  Absolutely delicious! Although I will admit it was tough to eat a whole egg with chop sticks. ;-)   Will definitely be going back to YUME for another visit.   Thanks guys.

AQJVFx9dmmvJhkVdE_ceeQ.text: Spot on ramen - as good as you get in Japan. The sushi and side dishes are great - the sushi chefs are actually from Japan. The service is good. I love the colors and art work. So nice to have free and open parking in South end. Don't keep wondering if you should try it - just go.

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Miso ramen

O90K1XZxrQ9psl92tnUu4w.text: They are back! I was a long time visitor when Yume was in Matthews, and wondered when the relocation would finish... here we are in 2018!  The flavors are still there, well seasoned food, done with finesse. Still working out some slight kinks it seems like in the first week with more tables to serve, but no loss of the tastes I remember.  Our table ordered four appetizers (wasabi octopus, chicken skewers, grilled mackerel, and soy sauce salmon) and we all got the garlic ramen. I prefer a stronger garlic flavor, others may not, but the base ramen broth and the soft boiled marinated egg were memorable. From the appetizer selection, I'd skip the chicken skewers, maybe go more seafood based and then just crush a bowl of ramen.  One suggestion... figure out how to make the garbage can not be part of the parking lot! Still 5 stars for the food. It's unfortunate to have to smell the summer garbage going in, but probably worse after having a nice meal.  Go enjoy yourself and splurge a bit. Looking forward to when they have a "full" menu after the opening week!

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

PeJcPs5vEgwivMgboNdP3w.text: This place just opened up yesterday and by far offers one of the more authentic Japanese sushi restaurants to hit the Charlotte scene.  The elegant decor is soothing yet modern and the vibe is a mix of upbeat yet classy without the need to dine here in a coat and tie or your best Sunday dress.   The sushi chefs put on a show with their knife skills when they make sushi in front of you (we were seated at the bar)  We ordered the the daily special whole Aji (horse mackerel) as it's something you don't normally see, head and all but maaaaaan was it delish!  I've also never had the Kazukono (herring roe) before and was quite surprised at the awesome texture, it was salty and sweet and firm and the mouth feel was like a thousand micro grapes popping against your palate.   The omakase today was superb, so always ask about that and what fish just arrived fresh from Japan. YES!  Some of their fish are flown in from Japan!  The omakase is served with FRESHLY GRATED WASABI, not the usual powdered wasabi you see everywhere.   My wife had the tonkotsu ramen, and just as we remembered the wonderful flavors of ramen from their Original location, their ramen continues to be on point.  The noodles were cooked right, flavors strong but not overpowering and the ramen came out piping hot.   It's still kind of a soft opening but the selection is already impressive with items not normally found in any regular Japanese restaurant.   Ya gotta come in and try it.   I'll let the pictures do the talking now!

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

7NRR7v9pL0NVQ0Q1eRVzcQ.text: The white chairs were stained and the service was abrupt. We each ordered ramen and a sushi roll to split. I ordered the vegetable ramen and literally spit up half of it while sitting at my seat. My friend said the seafood ramen was decent, better than Futo Buta.  I will not ever go back. Would give it a 0 stars if I could. After posting this review, the owner contacted me and has tried to disprove my comment of regurgitating my meal. I have no reason to lie or make that up except to share my True experience here. I found it rude that she only took offense and did not ever apologize for the poor experience I had.

VnDoN-diGsUjD8L8upDRfA.text: Yume is a great addition to South End this year. It has ramen, dedicated sushi chefs, a full bar, and a variety of menu options.   Pros: + Opens late (till 11 p.m.) + Great ramen (my favorite is the Curry one!) + Big selection of drinks (like sake!) and food + Lots of table and bar seating, I doubt you'll ever wait in line - Comfortable seating and nice decor  Cons: - Some food items are hit or miss - Sushi is nothing to rave about  Overall a great choice. I think Futo Buta has the better vibe and location, while Yume has more options and seating.

GmTcqX46fzj3cruSBlvjhQ.text: Really flavorful broth. Nice chewy noodles. Great sushi. Gonna revisit after they shake off the first 60 day craziness.

nt8-77pWj_B6WKZZx1RWOw.text: I came here for drinks and apps and was very impressed. Great atmosphere and the drink menu is well thought out and crafted to perfection. I had the Blueberry Crush and the Lemon Old Fashioned and both were excellent. For apps I just had the pork gyoza and it was decent. Will definitely come back for lunch or dinner

SOTmvpOAEbiiHQPDqhMznQ.text: Me and my husband only come here once or maybe twice every week?? . Love this place! Sushi is fresh and delicious! Ramen is delicious as well! Wayyy better then most places I've been to in charlotte. Service is great. Everyone is super nice. Love the vibe.

qyRxaAAb2FKkmkocQ4x8mg.text: This is by far the best sushi restaurant I've been to. I have a gluten allergy and i am lactose intolerant. Any other place it is always a hastle and i feel like i am a burden trying to order food a special way. Our server Chris told me there were plenty of options not to worry they would take care of me . Well they took very good care of us . We got edamame with miso and a tuna tower and they both were amazing and safe for me to eat ! The sushi chef also took special care without me asking he brought me gluten free soy sauce! For our meal we had ramen i was able to substitute rice noodles and when i didn't like the first bowl they offered to make me a different one with no problem . It was also very good . This place is hands down the best for sushi, ramen and fantastic genuine service ! I felt like Chris did in fact want me to have a safe and tasty meal.

sYzvnrSmNFjVwv-hyJ-kJQ.text: Good spot for hibachi very reasonably priced for its location. Sushi and miso soup also worth a taste. Friendly staff.

9OoEdoyq_wDHxXEMWvfo8g.text: Good looking place. I should start by saying I tasted the most awful ramen. It was like dishwasher water and I could smell it before it even hit the table. I had it replaced with a different one that only looked different but tasted just as awful. I'm glad it's over. To be fair, the sushi was incredible and the fried oysters opened my appetite before the ramen slammed it to the ground.

iQt348x1cpe7INBKV7h6pg.text: This probably was the worst ramen I have ever had in my life don't order ramen from this place!! If you like ramen my best option in Charlotte is nikkos then futa Buta. However the appetizers were great and there sushi was good NOT THE RAMEN

RbfOft68lvWwPzlE7ddc8A.text: Delicious sushi! Couldn't be more impressed, really great service as well. Can't wait to come back and try the ramen.

wn2S-bJyP5qfVzsubpaOPQ.text: I love ramen. When I looked on Yelp for a ramen restaurant that wasnt my go-to spot in Charlotte, Yume popped up. So I went. It was date night and also my suggestion since we both love ramen. We got there, and they had valet which is dope. The hostess took us to the back table nearest the restrooms. Cool. No problem. Except for the GNATS. The gnats, as in a squad of them, were hovering around the soy sauce kettle. I went back up to the hostess and requested a different seat. I feel like she was already aware of the gnats and just didnt care about the sanitation). We were then seated in front of the windows but not so far because a gnat floated to our table:-/. Anyway, I ordered the spicy vegan ramen and he had a rice bowl. The "ramen" is not ramen  they use rice noodles. Not even to be a noodle snob (but it is what it is), you can taste the difference. Rice noodles are flat, stringy, and dont absorb flavor. Eww. His rice wasnt sticky rice so he didnt finish his bowl. I sent the rice noodles back and had sushi. Ive had better :-(

M3TRLPgOAc-HVDuHVwCPWw.text: Service was excellent and the sushi was fresh and delicious. Ramen was perfect. Would definitely recommend to anyone interested in a great dining experience.

QubaeBUIKGMloALXdJXfEg.text: My mom and I ate at Yume when it was located in Matthews and it was amazing. We just had to come visit when they moved to Charlotte and we were not disappointed. The food, as always, was amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly and the place is beautiful!! I had the teriyaki salmon and my mom had her favorite, shio ramen. This place is a must try!!!

KxpjPm3b8A4moMcT-iBBSQ.text: Definitely try the pork katsu.  One of the best in the country.  The mussels and fried oyster are ok, not that intriguing.

xx7My4Go22ZIAYoqljkzkA.text: My table ordered the black garlic, shio, and spicy miso tonkotsu. Compared to Futo Buto (just around the corner), this place hits the smell and flavor profile of any random ramen shop in the Tokyo/Chiba area; as far as tasting like Tonkotsu in Fukuoka, this place doesn't come anywhere near (but neither does Futo). Overall, the shio and black garlic tonkotsu ramen were bland and lacking in flavor. The spicy miso was very good. Additionally, they were pricy as pork belly does not come standard and is charged as an extra; bringing the total price of each bowl to 20~ USD. Although Futo Buto is "less" authentic, I would choose it over Yume.

ufJUHjgndle4-jFbTWFABA.text: Finally, great fresh, sushi! Ramen was tasty too, full of yummy noodles and mushrooms.  Good selection of beers too.  Knowing Charlotte is short on help and this place is new, I give them a pass on clueless, disorganized, but very nice servers. Looking forward to coming back and trying more sushi!

vCFiAezQzAv44t_mwM8xVg.text: Been here twice, and while it wasn't bad, it missed the mark both times. Some of the food is quite good, but rather pricey. The hostesses were very businesslike with little to no interaction, and while the waitstaff was friendly, they did not seem fully trained. You should not have to look at your food for over five minutes before you get your plates and silverware. The atmosphere is pleasant and they have some good ideas, but overall, there are better places I would rather go.

XLGGqa4Fltuzzk-FWxoDRQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Hands-down the best teriyaki chicken I have ever had and the gyoza was some of the best too! This was also the first place I tried sushi and it did not let me down. We will definitely be coming back here for the happy hour specials again

GusM79-nTdWNngNGq3zaqg.text: Service was great, food was just OK. Sushi roll selection wasn't very exciting. Ordered two rolls and the Thai coconut curry ramen. I have to agree with other reviewers that the broth was pretty bland. I'll stick to futo buta for ramen.

-IJ6MAgDGEED7byENTTEZw.text: Atmosphere and opening week logistics aside, the ramen and sushi at Yume are a game changer and set the new standard in Japanese cuisine in the Charlotte area. Let's start with the ramen... I've eaten ramen all over the world including in Japan many times, and this is hands down the best ramen around. The reason so....simply the broth. They take the time to boil the bones for many hours and the result is a creamy, rich, and delicious flavor. They understand this is the most important aspect of a ramen dish, unlike Futo Buta, who miss this critical step. While the ingredients at Futo Buta are fresh and delicious, the broth is too thin and salty which is a major misstep. Double the hours the bones are boiled and you'll have the perfect ramen, but until then, my go to for ramen is Yume. The fermented black garlic tonkotsu is a showstopper!!!  Now for the sushi...it's amazing! They get their fish directly from Japan and have Japanese sushi chefs who have many years of training in proper preparation. The fish is very fresh and melts in your mouth. The pieces are good size and the chu-toro is out of this world delicious with marbling after marbling. The only downside is the atmosphere and this can improve by upgrading the music selection to modern lounge music and dimming the lights. I am confident the logistics will improve in time. Do yourself a favor and eat here now!

bpyi6cnWSp4XxAYsL4YbgQ.text: Along with O-Ku, this is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in Charlotte. Their fish is fresh and high quality.   The ambience is casual and I see lots of couples on dates when I arrive, or small groups of friends.   The menu is diverse and I enjoy trying the sushi specials.   Recently I visited and they seemed understaffed with many sections of the bar not clean. It was a Saturday night, so I understand the rush, but that left an impression.

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu ramen (rice noodles) with spicy miso broth.

ty38k4IAyz2AM8VmMVflHg.text: I was in town for work and a coworker and I gave Yume a try after searching for a sushi restaurant. We called ahead asking if they could accommodate a party of two if we were to arrive in about 30 minutes and they said yes. When we arrived we waited around 5 minutes before being seated.  The service was slow. It took awhile for our server to take our order and then all of the tables around us received their order before we did. We had ordered a few sushi rolls and I had ordered miso soup and I think at least 30 minutes went by - if not longer - before the soup came out. I ended up asking a hostess to check in on our order after she walked by our table. We had to ask to have our water refilled and it was just....slow. The excuse was that the kitchen was backed up with the ramen orders but the sushi chefs were right in front of us and not working on ramen.  When the food came, the sushi was good though the soy sauce provided was extremely salty. I realize we could have asked for a low sodium version but at that point we were just hungry. The ramen looked good and like a huge amount (pretty much everyone was taking some home around us) so maybe that's the thing to try there.

dEEPRIKMeBxHZnp0go19Gg.text: This was our first time at YUME and having Ramen. We both got the spicy version of the Seafood Ramen. I tried it with the soft boiled egg and my did not. I did like I saw on the YouTube vids and split it in half, followed by adding on some of the onions and seaweed to it. It was great.  The traditional Sushi rolls were great! They truly melted in our mouths.   They funniest part of the experience was : since I rarely carry cash, I had to go atm hunting because the city dedicated to knock out the Internet in the general area.  We did take out and everything was great once we finally got to it later at the house. We can only imagine how great it is if we could have stayed to dine in.

hg9BmZKvJBM-fVP0DKgzxA.text: Met a friend here for a final dinner before she moves next week & we weren't impressed. This was both of our first times and we knew it was pricey but it's definitely not worth it at all.  It's a nice size restaurant with nice decor but they have cream chairs that you can see the soy sauce & other food spills on. They have a little happy hour menu from 4p to 6:30p and we ordered the pork belly bao and seaweed & squid salad off of it; both were $5. They were really good, I could come back just for the salad since it's so close to my house. The bao had like a little mayo based sauce on it that was unnecessary because you really couldn't taste it plus the pork had a lot of flavor on its own. For entree we decided to go with the Seafood Ramen to split, Kaze sushi roll, and a few pieces of nigiri. The ramen was like lukewarm and just okay to say the least, not memorable even after a couple hours. The sushi roll was good but nothing special especially for $15.  We also ordered a bottle of sake, we went with the Junmai Ginjo which was under the sparkling section but when it came out it tasted pretty flat but after speaking with our server she let us switch it out for a different one. This time we got the Mio and it was much better. Our server Susan was great-very helpful and made sure we were all go. Overall the food isn't worth the price but the service was good.

4DBI62okij4iDj55VLJZKA.text: Visited their new location in southend for lunch today. Great looking spot. Very modern, good sized bar. Everything's a bit more expensive now with appetizer portions being a bit smaller. Chicken karaage is still delicious. There was no dipping sauce with it. Sushi was decent and sashimi lunch was good. Did not get the rice that it was supposed to come with, but each of us also got ramen so it was enough. One complaint about the ramen was that the soup was warm, and not hot. The toppings are premade, and kept in the fridge prior, I understand that. But they should make an effort to heat up the toppings separately before adding the broth, or the temperature of the soup will cool. The broth was flavorful and noodles cooked perfectly. Eggs and pork were still somewhat cold in the warm broth. If this can be improved this would be one of the best ramen places in charlotte.

5DaAj6jfzKbylF3hjXzNjg.text: First time there, sushi chef was cool, didn't know who my server was, looked around to try and place another order, finished my meal. Price was alright for convenience. Sushi was 10/10. Ramen was a bit bland. I believe I was the only customer inside, was going to order something else but decided to just get the check, had to ask sushi chef about the check.

-DtVZuITA4Vvix5GWIS3ig.text: It's nice to have options for ramen.. I been going to Futo Buta. And I been dying to try this place out. Finally..  Sara was our waitress and she was excellent.. and when we stop by for lunch. It wasn't pack but they are busy. Yet, customer service is still great.  I ordered Miso ramen. Very comforting and flavorful.. I truly enjoyed it. Looking forward to coming back to try other items on the menu!

4cX-yJWP3Gwhud6tJhu5dQ.text: My boyfriend and I came during Queen Feast Restaurant Week. They were offering such an incredible 4-course meal for $35 per person. It really gave us a look into all things they offer at Yume. Since we have never been there, we though this would give us the best in site to what they offer.  We called ahead and made a reservation because we were worried they would be busy. When we arrived we realized they didn't have much parking in the parking lot available but they did have complimentary valet and plenty of street parking. It wasn't too busy, but the parking fills up fast so we went ahead and valeted.   When we sat down, our waitress was very prompt and attentive. It took us a little bit to figure out all we wanted and she was so patient with us. We ended up ordering the first two courses before we decided on our main course and dessert. You first choose a Beverage from the following options: Calpico Non-Carbonated Soft Drink, Calpico Soda, Oolong Tea & Japanese Coffee. We ordered the Oolong Tea which to our surprise came cold and in a can. It had no sugar in it so it wasn't my favorite. I drank it anyway though!  The first two courses were Appetizers from the Kitchen and the Sushi Bar. The options included items like: gyozas, Karaage, Tempura Vegetables, YUME Tuna Tower, YUME Hamachi Crudo, and more. For our Kitchen App, we picked the pork gyozas and Karaage (Chicken Nuggets). The gyozas were delicious, but I wish they had a special sauce to serve with the Karaage. the sauce that was on the side tasted a little like a mayo. Maybe ask for the Katsu Sauce if you order. For the Sushi Bar App, we had the Tuna Tartare and the Tuna Tower. I 100% recommend the Tuna Tower. It is a fried rice cake topped with avocado and spicy tuna. DELICIOUS!  Then it was time for the entree, we both decided to get different items. My Boyfriend got the Tonkotsu "Pork Broth" Ramen with Soy. The Ramen had Pork Broth with Pork Chashu, Woodear Mushrooms, Bean Sprouts, Sweet corn, Sesame Seeds, Seaweed, and a boiled egg. The broth tasted a little thick for me, but it was taste. I got the Sauce Chicken Katsu Don. I highly suggest for people who aren't super into asian cuisine. It is fried chicken over rice with sweet corn and a pickled veggie.  For dessert, they have the option between 4 different ice creams: green tea, red bean, black sesame, and ginger. We got the green tea and black sesame. I LOVED BOTH! I would suggest the green tea to people who aren't into super sweet desserts. The Black Sesame Ice Cream was so surprisingly good. It kind of tasted like a coffee ice cream, but not as strong.  It was truly a great choice for restaurant week and I cannot wait to return. Next time I will go back and get the sushi.

_PUDQHY92bzUUrslGLvqXQ.text: Solid spot for ramen. Didn't have any sushi rolls, but they seemed to be a pretty popular for the diners. The sake list is good, described well for people who don't "know their sake". The ramen choice is short but tasty, with an opportunity to add in favorites items and personalize it.  Because Futa usually has a long wait this is a good back up for ramen but and an even better one for the variety of menu.

wDjznhXUcjVeB0oN_-WVmA.text: The best sushi i ever had . Excellent food, excellent service from our waitress Morgan. If i could give more than 5 star I definitely will give them a 10. I 100% recommend this place

5AExYkOk5snOpQKT_s4JyQ.text: My husband and I came here for date night and loved it! What I really loved at first was the ambiance. It has a premium/upscale look inside, however it is still very casual. We saw several people in t-shirtd and hoodies, as well as others dressed up a little more. I would call it classy casual!   The food was amazing! The ramen bowls are HUGE! So you will not go hungry, and the apps are also great. I felt the prices were just right, chairs were comfy, service was attentive and friendly....overall a big win!   When I'm not pregnant, I will be back to try their signature cocktail! It is made with purple sweet potatoes, so it has this purply/pink color, and from how the bartender explained it....I just have to try it!

2VHjIPIjTZ3xlL4R1E7rbA.text: Yume is a beautiful restaurant located in a BOOMING area, and it will probably do really well. However, I just think that right now, they're overcharging for the quality of food that they're putting out. Not saying it's bad food - because it's not. At all. I just think you can probably find better for a bit cheaper elsewhere.  Pretty much everybody at our table had ramen on their minds, but I wanted to start out with an appetizer - Takoyaki. They did it well - a tiny bit underseasoned, but overall a good execution of a fun dish!  I ordered the coconut curry, as did somebody else in my group, and it arrived quickly (as did everybody else's dish). Unfortunately, it just wasn't up to par with other coconut curries in the area. It was, again, underseasoned and the coconut didn't shine through at all, neither in mouthfeel or flavor. I think I've been ruined by Kung Fu Noodle up in Huntersville. Just wish it was closer! We had excellent service and the rest of the menu looked great, it's just not the cheapest option in the area and the quality didn't really justify the price for me. I'll check it out for other things on the menu, but this won't be my first pick unfortunately!

J70JOmLAfVc_NTr19jJ2JQ.text: I went back. I tried the pork cutlet (not called that) and it was excellent! So good in fact that I went back the next day and had it again. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

kzuVbfn5KgYGHzZDkS5nBQ.text: Ramen was good - the only thing I complain is that the pork belly was not good; it should have been cooked longer to be softer. Takoyaki was great - could be better with more octopus in each one.

yFAxQFtcXUQJjovIZBvRUw.text: I came here tonight because I was craving ramen and wanted to give somewhere that's not futobuta a shot.  We started with the bao buns, which were fine, but were drenched in spicy mayo, the pork belly was tender, but nothing extraordinary. -7i8IMvLhbBwido15YgnxA.text: Best Ramen in Charlotte! Crave worthy!!! Went because hubby and I were craving Ramen. Had the best meal in a very long time. Staff was attentive and very knowledgeable! From Sake to Sushi they knew their stuff. The staff suggestions were on point. The black garlic ramen is beyond amazing! Everyone needs to try this place! We will be craving ramen and definitely coming back here!

pgWMmhjNnssLfFpJh1OhTg.text: This place is good!!! Food is good, recommendations for appetizer takoyaki and kanuni buns, especially the buns they  are  gorgeous,  my entree is tokunsu ramen (shio) means that have salt instead of soy sauce, no seaweed and no egg, broth is not flavorless like some people implied but it has a more light flavor than other places!! The cocktail ube sawa is the best!!! I had the cucumber refresher too but the ube sawa is the one , sweet and different, simple presentation and gorgeous purple colors , I don't eat sushi  but my brother say that is very good, very fresh.  Want to avoid the crowds, come around 5 pm , around 6 is kinda crowded!

F3QOIvRqAdrwYWNzXETc2g.text: This was rough. Our service was odd, the woman didnt drink and couldnt advise us on sake. Not sure why they couldnt send someone else to help, and she kept coming over to try to clear plates when we werent done. The sushi was iffy and my ramen was totally tasteless. Not coming back here for sure.

XRvlPaYhe4xumO446W8cXw.text: Finally checked out the new ramen spot in the Gold District.  It had been on my radar for a while, it's just hard to find a time to hit it up and avoid the crowds.  Located at the corner of Summit and Mint St, YUME is a cozy spot.  Though I was just watching people tackle the 4 way stop, flashing red light, that's out there and there were definitely a lot of cringe worthy moments.  I definitely need to not face the street next time I come here.  There's. Small parking lot behind the building that filled up pretty quickly for lunch, however the actual dining room was not really full. I don't know what the parking situation is like on weekends, but I have a guess.  Across the way is Max and Lola's... which is a cool spot, but there's limited parking as well.  I ordered the tonkatzu with spicy miso and it was a solid lunch pleaser.  Also tried the octopus hush puppies and they were amazballs!  Pun intended.  Staff and servers are super friendly here and will take the time out to explain the menu if you have questions.  The kitchen runners also make you feel welcome and make sure you are happy with your dining experience.  The dining room is clean and modern... white with some interesting light fixtures.  There are TVs in the dining room so there's opportunities to watch sports here.  Unfortunately the tv I was facing was on CNN. With the upcoming midterm election, and the four way intersection, I was a nervous wreck after lunch (jk).  The dining room has huge garage doors that would make for an awesome atmosphere when the weather is great.

YzSajUtDnBnBusSF9J-fHQ.text: A bit of a let down.  Came on a Tuesday for dinner, and we weren't too impressed. Little to no greeting when we arrived. Service was slow even with an almost empty restaurant, and while we were there the server we had lost another table's credit card. Wow.   Drinks took a while to be delivered. I had the lemon ginger old fashioned. It was actually quite good. I enjoyed the spin on a classic. Most of their drinks are classic drinks with an Asian twist, which is cool.   We ordered the Kage and Hi sushi rolls and the fermented black garlic ramen to share. The sushi rolls were fine, but nothing to write home about. There are so many good sushi places in town it makes it hard to compete. The ramen was pretty good. I wanted a bit more flavor and seasoning in the broth.   We can walk here from my house, but I may be going elsewhere for sushi and ramen.

wH0RjGyFIqogUk83RjjpTg.text: Futo's got my heart. I hate to say it but honestly this place is overpriced and it's just aight.   I like my eggs.... poached and my meat.... tender.   The one thing YUME ramen got on Futo ramen is the broth. It's a lot more flavorful. It reminds me of a spot we went to in NYC. The fermented garlic is a flavor I wish Futo would get up on cause it was hittin it. Could have used a tad more salt but it was really good. But that's all I can say for YUME.  The only eggs I like are over medium or poached. I like poached in Ramen cause it adds a little creaminess to the broth. Perhaps the soft-boiled egg is more traditional ramen; and if it is, it's just not my style.  The meat was kinda chewy. I added pork belly and it was extremely fatty. Like no meat at all. I gave it to my husband.  The noodles were underdone IMO.   The only accoutrements I liked was the corn and bean sprouts.  I was feenin' for some ramen, so I was disappointed with this place in that aspect and others.  Let me back track.... I ordered a Lemon Ginger drink. I tasted no lemon or ginger. Really all I tasted was alcohol. It was STRONG-ARMING my tastebuds. But for $14, please believe I drank that sucker down!  The sushi was meh. I should have known too. The only place I should get my sushi is from my beloved Fujo. Godzilla roll has been my sushi since jump. So I don't even know why I bother with other places. I guess I should have known it was going to be plain based on the price ($6). Oh well.  Lesson of the day: Stick to Futo. The texture of noodles have fallen off a bit and the broth could be updated but for the most part I know what I'm getting for the price.

SU1QWqELfqsjEh8Cx7c83A.text: Really liked Yume Ramen bar! They had a wide variety of fish and they made everything properly. The sake was excellent and the wait staff is knowledgeable on the type of fish they had at the time. The Ramen was underwhelming, they made a big deal about it but I didn't find it to be that great. But it had a lot of great pork belly in it which I appreciated because most places only put a couple of small pieces. If I was back in Charlotte I'd probably go there again

CCWPY47qa31ZwvplwzoO2Q.text: I was really excited to try this place when I read about it before it opened. I read some mixed reviews after it opened, but I still wanted to try it. We weren't disappointed.   We went for an early dinner on Saturday and parking is kind of a pain. They have a small lot, but it was full. They do complementary valet which we ended up doing after we couldn't find a spot.   We were seated right away. We decided to split a sushi roll and went with the Sakura. It was very very good. We were fighting over the last pieces. My friend and I both got the Thai Coconut Curry Ramen and my husband got the Tonkotsu Ramen. I really liked the ramen. The broth was very flavorful. I tried a bite of my husband's which was also good.   The only downside is that our food was pretty slow to come out. It wasn't that big of a deal and the restaurant was fairly crowded.   I would definitely recommend giving this place a try!

obKtEBR9qNNIMmMHyHdI6Q.text: I went to Yume for dinner on a rainy, cool Saturday evening - the weather screamed RAMEN!  We got there around 6:30 pm and were seated right away.  The venue is clean and crisp with plenty of windows on one side and a beautiful sushi bar on the other.    We started our meal with a bottle of sake -- they have a nice selection of options at a variety of price points.  My husband and I both ordered bowls of ramen.  They were flavorful and so very tasty.   The ramen choices were mostly with pork - there was a seafood and a vegetarian option, but all of the other choices (including the one with chicken broth) included pork.  I would love the option to switch out the pork for beef or chicken.    Overall, we had a great meal with terrific service.  Check it out - you won't be disappointed.

Z0Bol2gFWb8AGLzb2GK3mw.text: Their Fermented black garlic tonkotsu is delicious and I would highly recommend it to EVERYONE. The  soy egg is sooo good! I'd actually eat it as an appetizer!  The ambience was f the restaurant is very clean peaceful and colorful. It was so cute seeing the koy fish painted on the tables. Very small and easy to miss but a joy to find !  I would advise everyone to make sure the bartender is in. I made the mistake of ordering an old fashion. The bartender was NOT in and I was given something that resembled a half shot with ice.  So please ask them if an actual drink specialist is present. If not enjoy the food ! Definitely will come back even if only for the egg !!

o-Ea6eg-TPX02nbclZ3tnA.text: We order takeout for work often, weekly for almost 1 year. They have been open for more than 1 year and still don't have a website. Come on guys, facebook is not a viable business presence and your menu changes. Those changes need to be reflected on your website. A picture of your paper menu is not an acceptable replacement. Food great, service is lacking. I feel like this place could do much better and I want them to.

p_c9DiJs2Dh1v1sHbOF2hA.text: Glad we were able to pop in and check this new spot out in South End! I think it's location, even with tricky parking (but they have a free valet) will do well here!   We got there early, around 5:30, and they were super accommodating to the fact that we needed space for a stroller and also wanted to be "out of the way" of others, and it was not a problem for them! They gave us a perfect spot and didn't even seem the least bit upset by our requests (first seating and then a hot cup of water to warm a bottle) which, to me, goes a long way!   We went for sushi this time, and will need to come back to try the ramen. We started with edamame, which has sesame seeds in addition to the salt, and it was a nice touch! Then we ordered a spicy tuna, spicy salmon and a speciality roll with salmon and eel. Everything was delicious- the fish was fresh, the fillings were crisp, and the size of each roll was great. I know it's nothing exciting, but my go-to at every sushi spot is a spicy tuna and I use that as my comparison and I loved how this one was all tuna, just a little cucumber, and the spicy sauce (which was spicy) was mixed in. It wasn't my favorite in Charlotte, but it was darn good!   We will have to come back to try the ramen, but it was a great meal and a wonderful spot for a sushi date night.

HDL3bnZv0f1QU5PRGLBKUw.text: Places change. What a shame. I used to really like coming here. I wish I had written a review back then. Then we could juxtapose "then" me with "now" me. They used to have a very generous chirashi bowl, and lovely fresh amazing fish. Truly.  Now I'll be completely honest- they still do have good quality food. Gotta give credit where credit is due. But because of this, it's as if someone decided that validates halving the portions. The quality is outstanding. I had a chirashi bowl tonight that had beautiful fish. But it was less than half the size of the previous.   I enjoyed all of it- don't get me wrong. I patiently waited as the drinks always took longer than 10 minutes to get to our table. Each time. (Beer- you know- pour it, bring it). And I waited patiently because the drinks were indeed good. I waited for my chirashi bowl. A long time. I figured because it is special. My wife got her meal 15 minutes before mine came. She also waited patiently. Because it looked good, truly, and we were looking forward to the experience of eating TOGETHER.  And when it came (we noticed it had been sitting in the counter for 5 minutes) it came in a breakfast bowl. It was a cute little breakfast bowl, with a nice fancy pattern. But I would eat cornflakes out of this tiny thing. And not many of them.  Then as we were paying the bill, we noticed they had a special on the menu "mini chirashi bowl" and saw that the whole thing might have been a misunderstanding. Phew. How funny. How cute!  So we mentioned it, and the manager came and explained clearly that we got the True full chirashi bowl, and that the mini is smaller. About half the size (It must come in a teacup, I imagine?) The manager also went on to explain how we got 10 different varieties of fish ( I counted 6) and 15 pieces (I counted 12 tasty, but SUPER small pieces). The manager went on to say that she knew it is very different from previous, but this was the "direction they want to go" with things from now on. She made this point multiple times. It was like she was saying "this is what we do now". "This is how it is".  So I get it- I sound like "that guy". And this review is a waste of my time. Read it- laugh at what a redneck I must be and move on. Whatever. But honestly, check my other reviews. They are usually 5 star, and they are always honest. At the price point we paid, (28 dollars for the "breakfast" chirashi bowl) we got, honestly, excellent quality food (truly, I have to say), but VERY little of it, and pretty ordinary to terrible service. And, unfortunately, this is now the third time this has been the case (since the changeover in personnel possibly). We are pretty patient for places we like, and so we have been here too. But you know. We are patient, but not stupid.  We are locals but unfortunately won't be back. There are too many wonderful options here in Charlotte/Wilmore/South End within a mile radius. Sorry. I'm sure their previous chef and staff left for a reason.

qzCSUW7Ygm3Xlux6ndexoQ.text: Food- 5 stars. Fresh and delicious. We started off with the buns and and 7 spice wings. The wings were crispy and flavorful. No sauce needed. The buns were ok. Just small. The ramen was good. I got the spicy seafood. It was huge and filling. The broth was savory. The toppings were great and they were very generous with it.   Service-1 star. We got sat right away. We noticed several others getting sat after us. No one came to greet us. We waited over 10 minutes!! The people that got sat after us already had their drinks and ordered and we still didn't even get greeted. Finally, someone from our table went to the hostess stand to tell the hostess. She tells the manager/possibly owner and he immediately gets us drinks. He tells us she will be right with us. She finally does a few minutes later. At this time it was approx 13 minutes! She greets us and seemed very spacey. We ordered our food and drinks. We get our appetizers in a timely matter as well as our food. But she never came back! We literally had to flag her down to get drinks because our drinks were completely empty. So empty we were sucking on ice. She never checked up on us. She literally took our order and gave us one refill of drinks because we asked and gave us our check. She was soooo slow. She didn't even seem that busy.   I wouldn't mind coming here again if we didn't have her as a server. We were there forever when we didn't need to be.

RcSpSNP5ySe_3fqN9YzQRQ.text: This place lacks, well, basically everything. However, most importantly, consistency. Trust me, a bummer as I am within walking distance. Nothing about this place is worth paying full price - however, they run a pretty good happy hour special (both early and late.)  The vibe is off, mostly because it's generally empty. The appeal is lacking.   The food is good. Decent, however as mentioned above the consistency is off. From ingredients, to sizing and to portion.   I've found this place palpable with the combination of walking distance and happy hour until my last experience. As usual, my dining partner and I walked over a little after six. As we sat down we noticed the menu had changed. We inquired with the server regarding Happy Hour (the only reason as mentioned worth going.) The server said no, it is over, it's "almost" 6:30. I re-inquired, as it was not 6:30 yet. The server confirmed that we would not receive happy hour.   As I left I called YUME to confirm as to whether or not they still participate in their Happy Hour in which the host confirmed they did until 6:30 P.M. The server blatantly LIED. Chose to create his own rules. The server mentioned they were the only asian place open (Monday.) We happily went to O-KU  I asked for a manager, and the host sounded confused as to how and why I would ask. My guess, with the lack of professionalism, they don't have a proper manager. I was told the manager was in a meeting and would call back - a week later, no call.   There is a reason this place is poorly rated. Stick with anywhere else.

rI9tYifFfC6DsyAt4NXVvw.text: My fiance and I tried this restaurant on a date night. We both love Ramen and we both love sushi. We thought Yume was going to satisfy our desire for sushi and ramen that night and that we were going to have a new and good go to place for Asian cuisine.   Unfortunately, we left quite underwhelmed. With the priciness of the menu we were expecting something more. The service was prompt and friendly and had a very chill and relaxed atmosphere. We had no wait time and it was not super busy, which should have been our first red flag for a restaurant in South End on a Friday night.  Now I am not saying that the food was bad at all because it really wasn't! We ordered the Kage sushi rolls, which had shrimp tempura and Spicy salmon and a pork Ramen bowl. It was not terrible but if I am paying $14 for roll of sushi and $14 for a ramen bowl I would expect something a little more flavorful and a little more exciting. It was just "Eh." With so many restaurants in Charlotte I don't think I would waste my time or spend the money to come here again. I think this restaurant has potential and maybe with a change in menu or lowering of their prices this place could be something good, but for now I will stick with other restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ramen Bowl
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kage Sushi Roll

WwWWMLGPJwcz2qeUxkIZYA.text: We went here for the June 2019 Charlotte Restaurant Week and I honestly believe it was one of the best values!   They offered one beverage with the meal and I got the sake carafe, which was 10 whole ounces of hot sake! I'm not the biggest sake fan and came with an empty stomach so I could only get through maybe a third of it, but it was still a good deal.   For my sushi appetizer, I got yellowtail cerviche which was phenomenal! It was so light and the yellowtail was extremely fresh.   For my kitchen appetizer, I had to go with the pork gyoza, which was pretty standard but very good!   For my main course, I of course went with the pork tonkatsu ramen with black garlic broth. The broth was so smooth and delicious, the egg was slightly sweet and jammy in the center, the noodles were thick and seemed to be homemade. The pork was decent, not the best quality but still very good!   For dessert, I got green tea mochi wrapped ice cream. The mochi was delicious and definitely outshined the ice cream.   All in all this meal was fantastic and I was very glad that I was able to try it all for $35 during restaurant week! Definitely give Yume a shot, even if it's not restaurant week!

Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkatsu ramen with black garlic broth. There is a marinated egg hiding in there!
Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork gyoza

6WjlpcgyY4IuLs0BUWK2jQ.text: My husband and I decided to give Yume another try tonight...  Since it was the 4th of July weekend, the restaurant wasn't too busy, so despite arriving near dinner rush hour at 6:30 pm, we slid right in with no wait.  We were quite hungry, so we ordered several apps, sushi, ramen, and even dessert!   Well, am glad to report everything was back on point to how I perceived this restaurant on my very first visit...Excellent! We enjoyed pretty much everything we ordered...from Miso Soup, Edamame and Shrimp Tempura, to Nigiri and Yume Special Maki Rolls, and above all, the Thai Coconut Curry Ramen. I highly recommend this dish...it's SO Good!! Unlike last time, the presentation was lovely...very Instagram-friendly...and yes, I WILL be posting! :) Also, LOVED their Matcha Green Ice Cream!  The place looked clean and polished, better music selection, no sports TV (personal pet peeve)...and the service was spot on. Our foods were prepared quite quickly, though fully hot and fresh...and our waiter was quite attentive and smooth all throughout. I also got to meet the Owner (Thanks, Rosena!), who was very nice and gracious, in addressing my gripes from our last visit.  I really love their menu, and hope to try one of their Katsu dishes, but I keep getting swayed by their Ramen specialties. Maybe next time?   Anyway, so glad to see that Yume is back on its game!

xZHCjAtDVJ6wypLs1xgRQg.text: I am pretty disappointed by my experience at Yume.   I ordered the Spicy Salmon roll and the philly roll. The philly roll was okay but the spicy salmon roll was not good. It was not spicy at all. When it was served to me I noticed a fishy smell and it tasted fishy.   The service and general vibe of the place was not good. OSNzQkKLudg_L2W5bTcciw.text: My sister picked this spot for her birthday dinner, and I'm always down for sushi! The atmosphere is nice, but definitely on the casual side. The parking lot had a valet which was helpful because it seems like the area is still developing some parking areas.   It was half price sake night, so the 3 of us split a bottle of sake. It was plenty for 3 people and delicious. I was really happy to see that they offered sushi wrapped in cucumber instead of rice. It was crunchy and full of really good fatty tuna. Our waitress was extremely quick and we didn't have to wait long for our meals.   Overall it was a fun experience. I would stop in here to try more of their special rolls.

U3pdSQ_Di-6P4zqEI0GqHQ.text: We've been to Yume twice, and both were great experiences, but the second time was for Queen's Feast, so I got to sample more of what they have to offer. This time we had pork gyoza as an appetizer, which was some of the best gyoza I've had in the area. Perfectly steamed and then pan fried, with a fantastic soy based sauce to go along with it. I opted for the tuna and avocado tartare for my second app. This was probably the best part of the meal. The tuna was super fresh and high quality, and the spicy sauce it was served with helped cut through the fatty avocado. So. Freaking. Good. Unfortunately, the only thing that disappoints is the main event. I'm a fiend for Tonkotsu, and Yume's just misses the mark. It's 80% there, but it's lacking the depth of flavor that other Tonkotsu brings to the table. I'm spoiled by Futo Buta in this regard.  One more small note, and this may have just been for Charlotte Restaurant week, but the deserts on offer were different flavors of mochi wrapped ice cream. I'm pretty sure this was the same stuff that you can buy in a box at the store. Our waitress mentioned that they had just gotten "another box" of the red bean flavor. Come on Yume, don't phone this stuff in on a $35 meal.  All in all though, a super pleasurable experience. I know a lot of friends who consider this their favorite ramen joint in Charlotte, so definitely check this one out.

RTCIdeYo1IIqDAhH9ptJIw.text: My husband and I have been dining here since the restaurant opened and every time it gets better and better. I wanted to note that tonight (6/23/19) there was a group of 6-8 people who were *extremely* belligerent and thus the restaurant was smart in denying them additional beverages (note that at least one of the ladies kept SCREAMING that they drove allllll the way from Concord to go there, and I later overheard that they were so drunk they'd need to take an Uber home). I was truly mortified for the staff, who have always been so kind to us, but they handled the incident with grace and all were relieved when the party went home.  Yume has some of the best sushi I've had in my whole life... tonight I had a special that included fatty tuna and salmon belly nigiri and my husband got two "surprise" rolls. He also got scallop nigiri, which was soooo creamy; the sushi chef later told us the scallop came from Japan! I've also had the black garlic ramen and pork katsu curry here -- everything is so delicious. We love their cocktails and various appetizers - get the pork belly bao for sure!! Thank you, Yume, for keepin' it classy and continuing to serve amazing food.

6OIHrrA4IHfHe_6Ugt6d0w.text: We had dinner here this past Sunday and everything was absolutely delicious. My husband and I value quality over quantity so we truly appreciate the quality and freshness of their sushi.   We are not ramen people so we cannot speak for their ramen but their sushi is superb. We did their Omakase, the giant orange clam appetizer, gyozas, the hamachi crudo appetizer and also several pieces of their otoro, chutoro and bluefina tuna nigiri. Everything was so fresh and delicious, awesome quality fish that's become quite rare to find in Charlotte lately.   We will definitely be returning soon, if not regularly.
