nUzNcVFbFj8TOm0JdhCo4g.text: Humph. I'm disappointed. I read the reviews but wanted to give this place a fair shot. The broth was mediocre. I was hoping this place had figured it out by now. The broth doesn't have nearly the depth of flavor as it should.  They charge extra for the traditional pork belly that's supposed to come with ramen. Instead they give you a more lean cut and cheat you out of your money.  The noodles are too thick for my liking but that's just a preference. I definitely won't be back here for the ramen and definitely do NOT recommend this location. There are other places that taken ramen flavor more seriously.

Cin2SoZrdetUKKpFnXrk9A.text: We were excited to try this restaurant for an early date night, but unfortunately we were underwhelmed by everything and likely won't be back. We had never eaten there before and our server didn't really know the menu that well. Our orders for our appetizers got messed up and we received the wrong item. There was an issue ordering our entrees (we were told that the printer got backed up) and it took forever to get our ramen. The person beside us who was seated after us had received his food, finished his meal and was getting his check before our food was even delivered. By the time our food finally came out, we were ready to leave. We were the only people in the restaurant when we arrived, and it was not that busy to be making all of these mistakes with food orders. On top of that, we felt the ramen bowls were mediocre in flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Yume Ramen Sushi & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

sfbAhltxh5zxKZblbS8SDg.text: Came here on a Friday night with a craving for Sushi & Ramen! This place did NOT disappoint. There was a wait for tables but no wait for the bar, first come first serve.  Our bartender/waiter for that night was DiSean. Since it was our first time there, he gave us a little history about the restaurant which I really appreciated and enjoyed. It was opened up by a husband/wife duo, Tony & Rosena. Originally they were located in Matthews but then relocated to South End. We learned the hard way that most sushi/Japanese restaurants are closed on Monday and Tuesday (how dare they!) in Charlotte since typically those are their slow nights. But not Yume! They decided to stay open every day, super hard workers. He mentioned that "yume" meant "dream" in Japanese because this was the owners' dream to open up this restaurant.   The restaurant is very clean and welcoming. And the food is awesome! Even the bartender's apron was schnazzy (he had slots for different spoons, tools, etc on his apron that made it super efficient for him to make drinks!). Unfortunately, I was sick and taking medication so I couldn't enjoy his concoctions. I did however opt for a hot water which he offered honey or lemon or lime. Nice additions, honey it is!   The sushi was super fresh, it definitely hit the spot. Consider, craving fulfilled! The tonkatsu ramen was perfection (pork was the best I've had in ramen), I had even told DiSean it might be better than the ramen I've had in NYC!  If I ever get a chance to go back to Charlotte to visit, I'm definitely coming back to this spot again!

MsNyTKzb0UZDIrtALMNOtg.text: As 2 stars states, Meh, I've experienced better.   I've been sitting on this review for about a week. My husband and I came to try Yume for a date night. It's trendy like others say. I imagine someone decided to get in on the trendy sushi/ramen train; flavor be damned. Both of us were distracted by huge TVs over our heads the entire time.   We ordered the tuna tower which looked great in other Yelper's photos. It's a fried rice cake with avocado and tuna on top. The major issue is it's sitting in a puddle of soy sauce that the rice soaks up. You have to eat it fast but it's impossible with chopsticks. We also tried the salmon which was overcooked, the ramen which was not flavorful with a hard boiled egg and a sakura sushi roll. The only saving grace was our waitress who was very nice. The food wasn't bad or offensive, we've just had better. $70 not well spent, I'm sorry to say.

UR7_78Hr8eOr3X9Mc8e-1g.text: Summary: Food = 4 stars, service = 5 stars, prices = 3 stars.  As stated above, service was great - very friendly and very attentive. We went for the Charlotte Restaurant Week (CRW), but after looking over the menu, realized that it wasn't that great of a deal, and you could actually get more off the regular menu for about the same price instead of the limited selection they offered. It was our first time there though, so one of us ordered off the CRW menu and the other ordered off their normal menu. I also ordered a Lychee-tini, and from the CRW menu the Japanese Hot Sake Carafe, both of which were very good. For appetizers, we got the Agedashi Tofu (from the CRW menu), and from the regular menu, the octopus hush puppies and a seaweed salad. The Agedashi Tofu was extremely bland and we didn't even finish it, so big disappointment there. The seaweed salad was very good. The octopus hush puppies were...interesting...but not something I would necessarily order again. For the next course on the CRW menu we got the YUME Crudo with jalapeno & ponzu which was good; four different fish, so nice variety and jalapenos added to it without being too spicy. For our main course, we got the Tonkotsu "Pork Broth" Ramen in Shoyu (soy) style from the CRW menu, and the Thai Coconut Curry Ramen from the regular menu. Both were...just ok. The noodles are definitely authentic, but the egg was overdone (and sort of brown) in both of them, and the broth itself was meh. The coconut curry broth was much heavier on the curry side than the coconut side, so not the "thai style" flavor combo we were expecting. We also ordered a roll off the regular menu ("Naomi") which was AWESOME, but a bit pricey at $15 IMO. Last but not least, the CRW menu offers a single mochi for dessert, and we got the Red Bean one. It was served cold on a plate and was quite good. Just for the record though, if you order the mochi from their regular menu, you get three. So all in all, it was pretty good, but food was hit or miss. It could be because of restaurant week (not all restaurants are able to keep pace during such high demand) so I would be willing to try it again. But I think I'll skip the ramen and stick with sushi in the future.

ODU5tEoB5l7JPsWuBZfvUA.text: So my hubby and I went to Yume on my recommendation. It is located near another restaurant that I frequent and since I absolutely adore me some ramen, I had to check it out. They offer complimentary valet which I didn't really understand. I know that the parking situation around that area is far and few between but it was a small lot and since we told her we were dinning at Yume she allowed us to park our own car (there was an empty spot right in front of us). We entered the front door and was greeted by a hostess. The tall hostess was nice and welcoming but the young lady that sits behind the counter barely gave us a hello. Side note**on our way out, she was eating a container of food at the counter. Now I have worked in restaurants and I know this is a big no no. I thought it was really unprofessional. The place looked really clean. We arrived around 6:20 and our server was Chris. He was nice through our entire dinner experience. He made suggestions and even gave us a to go water in a kiddie cup. The appetizer of octopus hush puppies weren't something I would order again. It contained just a small piece of octopus and the rest of this mushy filling. My hubby ordered the seafood ramen spicy. He enjoyed it and said it was really filling. I got the Fermented black garlic ramen. That had a lot of flavor and the broth was awesome. I would come back just for that.

The staff was friendly enough, but not super attentive. They were more interested in having conversations amongst themselves than focusing on the customers. They would answer questions when asked, but not really forthcoming of conversation or help.   The atmosphere is nice. It's a lot smaller than I anticipated. The decor is nice. The sake was good. They have a large variety of drinks to choose from.   I am anxious to try the food, because some of it looked pretty delicious. I will update after I have tried it.

m5ptLdRmkwD_MxZFQC9_ig.text: My husband and I tried YUME on the last day of Restaurant Week.  This is a great way to try this restaurant, since their Restaurant Week menu is such a great value, with lots of options to try.  And while we really enjoyed the food, there were a few things that make us not want to return.  We started with the gyoza and Takoyaki (octopus balls).  The gyoza was definitely the better of the two, and it's one of the best I've tried, being thin and crispy, with a delicious filling.  The takoyaki were tasty, but the filling was mostly doughy, with just a couple of bits of octopus.  Next, we had the tuna tower and hamachi crudo.  The tuna tower was absolutely delicious, and my favorite dish of the night.  I loved the rice cake and tangy sauce, and the tuna and avocado were fantastic.  My husband loved his hamachi crudo as well.  For our entrees, I had the Matsu specialty roll, and my husband had the spicy seafood ramen.  The Matsu had tempura shrimp, partially cooked salmon (?), avocado, and lemon slices.  The flavor was good, and this roll was similar to my favorite from Co, but just a tad less flavorful.  My husband said his seafood ramen was a winner, with the perfect amount of spice.  It was more flavorful than Futo Buta's ramen!  For dessert, we both had their green tea ice cream.  It was rich and creamy, and so good!  Our server was very attentive and helpful.  And the Prosecco cocktail special was delicious, with Prosecco, Pome, and lemon.   So, what didn't we like?  The music was absolutely dreadful.  It really ruined our meal.  They were playing this ridiculous pop (think Celine Dion).  Ugh.  Tables were really close together, too.  And their parking lot is very small, with a valet after 5pm.  I HATE valet parking, and there aren't any nearby parking garages, either.   If they'd fix the music, we'd brave the parking situation, but otherwise, I'm not sure we will.

KQqz78XJUqGmBd6uTSkLnA.text: Food tasted great but they need better management.  My husband's ramen order came first but my lunch (only one specialty roll) doesn't show up until after my husband finished his ramen.  The server keep apologizing and it is not his fault, overheard our server asked the sushi chef why it takes so long and the sushi chef snapped at him.  There were a total of 3 tables, 1 already finished eating, 1 lady at the bar, and us.  Can't imagine it takes over 30 mins to make one specialty roll.  Also don't see how "lunch special" is special.  It is the same price as you would pay for the specialty roll, only extra you get is either miso soup or salad that come with the lunch special.

YK4c4W1amZPdA_dNBiJGDw.text: Went here for the first time tonight and really enjoyed all the sushi rolls that I had. I wish the waitress would've told me what they put in my Mystery roll, but other than that I can't complain at all. Definitely will be back.

37O3jE9l9csF0WL7YJck4g.text: Sush was delish. Sushi bar is where it's at. Very nice "cooks" running it. Ramen was decent. Staff was a little confusing but over all satisfactory. 7/10 would bang again. I mean visit again. Worth a visit. But don't know that it would be one of my go to spots in Charlotte. Nothing stood out.

Q6sAa3PR-Ri5JKRK-fGiCA.text: This is a hard review to write....I really, really, really want to like this restaurant. After all I've been waiting nearly a year to try! When I found out about this restaurant they were getting ready to close their Matthews location and move and I have been patiently waiting for their re-opening. Unfortunately, you only get one chance to make a first impression and my first impression is great as far as food goes, but disappointing with everything else.   First, food - we got an order of gyoza and the spicy miso tonkotsu ramen. Gyoza was pan-fried and pretty good. The ramen was great! Creamy broth and a good helping of toppings. I was a little disappointed that there was an upcharge for extra or extra-extra spicy ramen, since the ramen was maaayyyyybe a 2 out of 10 on my spicy scale, but otherwise two thumbs up for the food!  Now the hard part....the service. I will preface this by saying I recognize and appreciate that the wait and kitchen staff was truly working their tails off. That being said are definitely some improvements that could have been made. While waiting to be seated we went to the bar for drinks, only to be told alcoholic drinks were not yet being served. After being seated, it took 10+ minutes to be acknowledged, during which time we perused the menu and chose appetizers and dinner options -- only to be told by our waiter that they were serving a limited menu. This was a bit disappointing as there were only a few available ramen and appetizer options out of the extensive menu. Could have been easily avoided by separately printing their limited "grand opening" menu. We ordered the gyoza and ramen and asked the waiter for a recommendation on sushi rolls, but he took our order rather hurriedly and promised he'd be back to take our sushi order. He never did. Then, we waited. And waited, and waited. It took about 45 minutes for our 6-count gyoza to come out. No extra dishes came with it, so we resorted to passing the gyoza dish back and forth between the two of us. 10 or so minutes after the gyoza came out our waiter finally came back to check on us to ask if we were waiting on anything else. Um.....yes.....our dinners? When our ramens finally came, they were served with braised pork belly rather than chashu as was advertised on the menu. I overheard the waiter tell a different table they were out of chashu. Fine, but would have been nice to be given a heads up when we ordered. We had to flag down several people several times to fill our empty water glasses. I get that the waiters were crazy busy. But hostesses/employees who are not seating customers or doing little more than standing around and who catch my eye and notice my empty water glass should at least offer to fill it. All in all, we spent about 90 minutes in the restaurant for 6 pieces of gyoza and 2 bowls of ramen. I don't think our experience was unique. Looking around, it looked like at any given time only 30-40% of the restaurant was eating -- the rest was waiting for their food to arrive. It seems like the problem was overseating. They were more concerned about seating as many people as possible with little thought as to whether the kitchen could keep up with the volume. Since the bar was not serving alcohol, they sat people at the bar and every bar stool was occupied. Our table for 2 was originally 2 tables meant to seat 4, but they pulled the 2 tables apart, leaving only a couple inches of space between us and the table next to us. It was a confusion for the severs too, who kept trying to deliver our neighbor's dishes to us since apparently we both had the same table number (because, again, it was meant to be 2 tables seating 4, but they pulled the tables apart so they could seat 2 parties of 2). The overall experience was cramped and frustrating. Hopefully in the future they will consider their customer's overall experience and wait/turnover time, not just seating as many people as possible as quickly as possible.  Will I be back? You bet! Will it be soon? Probably not. I had high hopes for this restaurant and still do. Hoping they work out their kinks and I can update this review with a stellar rating.

GZTn_CzvDtiRE22YLWnqWA.text: The Ramen in the restaurant is really good. They have been in Charlotte 2 years ago and now they re-open and the atmosphere is pretty good. The place is clean and feel comfortable. You must try it, you will love it.

mHFSvW4qwZg38cHmyighXw.text: Beautiful decor, delicious food, and friendly staff made for an excellent date night dinner! We ordered the edamame, miso soup, Yume special roll (with spice salmon and avocado), the flower shaped roll and the shrimp tempura roll. uKKASiaIrUug2v6FPlpD3g.text: Our visit started off good but when we got our appetizers they were cold. We then got our meals and they were room temperature. z4MGxqIL0rtwQycnva7cKA.text: We're so excited this place is in the neighborhood and had a chance to go for the first time last night. We started off with Miso soup, which tasted delicious and fresh. Although the Ramen bowls looked amazing, we decided to opt for sushi this time. XSRYZ4NjjmkbgMJbE6z8fw.text: By far one of the best ramens I have had in years. Homemade noodles in a wonderful broth and the sushi was phenomenal. WoXaNJI61nbJ9ro1K3DWZA.text: I don't understand how this place can justify the price for ramen noodles. xVRei0w4O5fnHIe9EQ3Ksg.text: Worst service. Somewhat of a rough start from the beginning and then it just went down hill from there. We sat at the bar, the bartender had a great personality but questionable service. He didn't replenish our drinks, we wanted to get a couple of bottles of sake and some beers and i guess he "forgot"  We ordered appetizers, they were ok...but cold. We didn't say anything so waited for our entree. Both of our ramens were super cold and bland. Mine actually tasted like i was drinking dishwater, it was that bad. While i did make a slightly custom ramen with extra toppings, My ramen was all messed up had 2 bites of it and returned it. Toppings were missing (and know you're getting  charged for the extra toppings) the bartender knew that we didn't like our food and didn't ask us if we wanted anything else or try to resolve this problem. We didn't say anything as we sat there for 15 min without any drinks and the bottle of sake we ordered. Ended up just getting our bill, and realized we were still getting charged for that $17 bowl of ramen we returned and was told "since you got so many extras we have to charge you for it" they couldn't and wouldn't take it off my bill...i told him we didn't even get the extras were getting charged for and they still wouldn't take it off. We asked the bartender to get the manager and it was clear that he didn't want to be professional or be a man to resolve this issue. It was like pulling teeth to get the manager out. Finally he came out (Jonathan) and it just went downhill from there. Jonathan i hope you're reading this. Man, you have a lot of learning to do. Never talk to a customer the way you did to us. He said "well we have to charge you for the mushrooms since he did bring it out after the fact" the mushrooms were disgusting and cold. If that was the fact then charge us for the $2 mushrooms and take the ramen off, it was disgusting. And he looked at me and said  "No.  you have to pay for the whole $17 bowl".  We went there for the first time because of Ashley (the bartender) she was amazing and she made sure our experience and food was as well. So we were very excited to return for a second time, but thank you Jonathan for making it the worst experience and we will NEVER come back!

ELvpX7iOVPWEl6EU8EnAMQ.text: This place has fabulous ramen not to mention spot on takoyaki! I stopped in for lunch on my way back to the airport. The funny thing is that I was actually looking for a different ramen spot I had visited on a previous trip to Charlotte and ended up here by mistake. Well I certainly got lucky as this place is great. Gabby my server was also super helpful and friendly. Check this place out ASAP!

_cnUWB2lRfaALBNZy05HEQ.text: This restaurant is high in cost and low in quality. The salmon sushi I had tasted like it was going bad and the seafood ramen was just terrible. The broth may as well have been ocean water. It tasted disgustingly salty and briney. And I usually love briney tasting things like oysters. The karage chicken was okay but it tasted more like normal fried chicken than japanese karage. The fermented black garlic tonkotsu ramen was decent but, at $16 a bowl, not even close to good enough to justify the price.   Over all, my experience here was very poor. Better versions of almost everything here can be found at different restaurants in town for a less money. I will not be returning.  Edit: I want to say though, they had a very fine service and wait staff. Very friendly and attentive.

1bAjllxbnzxbw5F-auqXjQ.text: They close their restaurant at 9:30pm some nights even though the hours on the door and website say 10pm.

TvcHlDZ2BQGrXQ6dhReq0g.text: Our 1st time visiting Yume. We live in Denver and originally from SoCal. We were extremely pleased with our visit. The location is great. The decor modern and new. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We sat at the. sushi Bar and were treated wonderfully. Eiji, Nick and Carlos are the bomb!!! Sushi was fresh and the dishes were clean and thoughtful!!!  WE HAVE FOUND OUR GO TO SUSHI LOCATION

FLJwTJMKDRQnps1cF8sW7A.text: I love this place so much. Their Ramen is so much better than that other place everyone raves about, and there is actually room to sit comfortably and not on top of people.  The inside is nice. Not crazy about the decor but that hardly matters when the food is so good. Their ramen is top notch, no complaints about the food at all. I almost didn't want to post this because I don't want this place jammed packed . But I have to say it's probably my favorite place to eat in Charlotte right now.

atsmGmYqpEupCj-V-CJblQ.text: Yume is a fantastic restaurant. I have been for both their lunch and dinner menu and enjoyed each experience.  The restaurant offers a modern vibe, that is comfortable for all guests. The hostesses and servers were wonderful and able to answer all of our questions.  While I've only had their sushi, and a few appetizers, I can say it was one of the best quality sushi that I have had in Charlotte.   We enjoyed the Avocado Bomb and Spring Rolls from their specialty menu as appetizers. We hope that they add these to the regular menu.  We will absolutely be back - very much enjoyed the atmosphere and food.

yR1h5VCPdVym4Yjo6Z5eng.text: I ordered the black garlic ramen and everything about it was so delicious...except the pork. It was so weird to have such delicious bites of vegetables, noodles, etc. then when it got to the actual meat of the dish it was so lackluster. The flavor of the meat was not at all complimentary of the flavor of the noodles, broth, etc. It tasted very western (for lack of a better term). I picture every other part of the ramen was artistically crafted by Japanese people who understand the nuance of great ramen, then the pork was thrown in at the end by a 57 year old WASP from Iowa named Annette Anderson. I ended up just picking the pork out and leaving it aside.

oui0r3CpWv1dayJtT4NmKg.text: Food was decent, but terrible service from the cooks, not the servers. The sushi chefs stared and laughed at me and my fiance, and even pointed. Definitely not going back here because of this back experience. I would not recommend for anyone. There are better sushi places with good service in Charlotte.

dZv_fRtwJWKel6BhgMyzrw.text: I was so disappointed given the reviews and price tag on this ramen. The broth taste like hot water and not even salted hot water. Thank goodness for making it spicy, otherwise it would have had no flavor. After adding a ton of salt , it was slightly more tolerable but still not good. I had the vegetable ramen so can't speak for other broths.

iuc72TblmflC5leGFQloxA.text: Amazing!!! The sushi is so fresh and exceptionally prepared.  The ramen was the best I've ever tasted.  The flavor of the broth was so complex and deep, the pork slices in the ramen are tender and totally delicious!! A delightful young chef and his wife own this restaurant.  You can really feel the love and care they put into it. Located just out of downtown in a nice neighborhood. Will definitely go back and would HIGHLY recommend to anyone who enjoys great food!!

2t3WXyZ6jO16_qZVVkWCkg.text: Best sushi in charlotte, great flavor combination, excellent customer service, excellent drinks. Very affordable as well.

yF5J30Kf2D053b9EM0w1pA.text: Ok I travel a ton and eat out all over the country.  Especially sushi and ramen.  This place is amazing.  If you like Spicy Ramen hey have the real stuff..  it's really good.  The sushi was also top shelf, fresh and well presented.  Two thumbs up.   Oh an the atmosphere is top notch as well...

tqm3Yswrfe1mg3fHOenGag.text: This is a solid 2nd place to futo buta. The sushi is not their strong point. Prices are expensive but they have an unadvertised happy hour!

z6Z5Wq5ZSggv_Q0LS20c1w.text: I had high expectations for this place, but was let down. I was meeting a few friends for dinner and upon arrival they told me they could not seat us until the entire party had arrived. Now, I would have understood this had there been a long wait. There were SEVERAL empty tables available, to the host's surprise my friends showed up within 5 minutes and *shocker* we were sat immediately.   The server came over and we told him it was our first time, he said he would go through the menu with us.  This really meant he was going to speed read through the menu- he was going so fast we had no idea what he was saying and it was impossible to keep up. I felt like I was cramming for a test!   We ordered the grilled avocado as an appetizer- which was AMAZING. I ordered the chicken katsu for my meal. This wasn't anything great, just a few breaded pieces of chicken in a fake curry like base with some rice. Definitely not worth $$. I had also asked for this dish to be "spicy" which it was not.   I was even more shocked with I received the bill- 1 appetizer, 1 drink, and 1 main entree came out to be almost $40.00!!  Even more shocking, there was a $1.00 upcharge for asking that the dish be "spicy". Are you kidding me?  This is the first time I have ever been charged for asking a dish to be spicy... and it wasn't even spicy.  Also, if there's ever and upcharge the server should ALWAYS inform the customer that it would be an upcharge.  That's just basic customer service.   I had previously heard good things about this place and unfortunately they're not True.  Save your money and go eat somewhere that's actually worth the time.

aNNUIX49Iro76coY7kbs4Q.text: The best ramen and sushi in charlotte hands down. Had the seafood ramen and it was awesome. The drinks are superb, very strong but don't taste like it.  Everything has a very distinct and special taste. The cheesecake is awesome.  Our waitress Mimi was my favorite so far, great service and recommendations.

2A4_plSIlU__wp36zP80gQ.text: O-G amen joint. Ambiance is nice and snap snap chilly willy,  too cool for school, type of vibe. The chairs are extremely comfy and clean. The decor is equally proper for the crowd they are trying to attract. Spouse loved the ramen and said it was the best in Charlotte. He ordered the spicy miso ramen and I ordered the pork tonkatsu with rice, egg, and onion. Both were delicious. Would go back again.

pWNQkSoefO5uPdJOxYc6tA.text: This is a great spot for a ramen and sushi stop. It's a clean, contemporarily decorates, and modern spot, great for a date night or even a small family get together. The vegan ramen was very good and whatever type of mushrooms were in the soup were delicious! Our service was on point, too! Good spot for sure, check it out!
